properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 5:26 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking an area of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts and up to nickel size hail. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Locally heavy rain is also possible. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-06T02:24:14-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-05T23:45:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0824947175.2020
Area: Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell, Red Lake - Woodland Caribou Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 4:59 p.m. CST, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This storm is currently vicinity Oungre and is tracking to the southeast at 35 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
Expires: 2020-07-06T01:55:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-05T23:00:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3463738494.2020

properties.Title: Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Squalls with wind gusts up to 45 knots, frequent lightning and hail up to 3 centimetres are expected or occurring in the area. A thunderstorm over western Shoal Lake continues to move east at 20 knots. Hazards: 45 knot wind gusts and 3 cm hail. Locations impacted include: Waters around the Northern Peninsula; waters around the Western Peninsula and waters west of the Aulneau Peninsula. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. For more information monitor Canadian Coast Guard radio or Weatheradio stations.
Expires: 2020-07-06T03:31:01-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-06T00:33:01-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3629660504.2020
Area: Lake of the Woods
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:57 p.m. EST (8:57 p.m. EDT), Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing torrential rain. This area of thunderstoms are located over southwestern Quetico Park and west of Saganaga Lake, moving northeast at 35 km/h. Hazards: up to 100 mm of rainfall. Source: RADAR indicates 100 mm of rain has fallen near Hilly Island in Quetico Park, with over 50 mm in surrounding areas. Locations impacted include: Hilly Island and other portions of southwestern and central Quetico Park. ### Rapidly rising rivers and creeks can sweep away bridges, culverts, buildings, and people.
Expires: 2020-07-06T03:22:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-06T00:58:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1847755069.2020
Area: Atikokan - Shebandowan - Quetico Park

One severe thunderstorm is located 5 kilometres northwest of Shoal Lake, moving east at 50 km/h. Hazards: 90 km/h wind gusts and nickel size hail. Source: RADAR indicated. Locations impacted include: High Lake, Shoal Lake, Clearwater Bay and Cul de Sac Lake. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 7:59 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a severe thunderstorm capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This cluster of severe thunderstorms is located from 20 kilometres south of Keewatin to 15 kilometres southwest of Sioux Narrows to 20 kilometres northeast of Lake of the Woods Provincial Park, moving east at 40 km/h. Hazards: 100 km/h wind gusts, nickel size hail, and torrential downpours. Source: RADAR indicated. Locations impacted include: Sioux Narrows, Sioux Narrows Provincial Park and South Narrow Lake. ### Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles.
Expires: 2020-07-06T02:58:49-00:00

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of dangerous thunderstorms that may be capable of producing damaging wind gusts and large hail. Hazards: - Damaging wind gusts of 90 to 100 km/h - Quarter to Toonie size hail Locations: Portions of Northwestern Ontario including Kenora, Fort Frances, Dryden and Red Lake. Timing: This evening. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Very strong wind gusts can damage buildings, down trees and blow large vehicles off the road. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm. For more information: http://www.emergencymanagementontario.ca/english/beprepared/beprepared.html.
Expires: 2020-07-06T08:31:44-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-05T23:54:44-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4069701018.2020
Area: Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake, Pikangikum - Poplar Hill - MacDowell
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. A disturbance moving over northern Manitoba today, combined with a hot and humid airmass is creating a favourable environment for severe thunderstorms to develop this evening. ### Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Strong wind gusts can toss loose objects, damage weak buildings, break branches off trees and overturn large vehicles. Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-07-06T04:59:11-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-07-05T23:58:11-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2840351976.2020
Area: Gillam, Shamattawa
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: At 6:46 p.m. CDT, Environment Canada meteorologists are tracking a line of severe thunderstorms capable of producing very strong wind gusts, up to nickel size hail and heavy rain. This line of thunderstorms is currently from northeast of Utik Lake southeastward to north of Gods and is tracking to the northeast at 20 km/h. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Heavy downpours are likely to cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Fast-moving water across a road can sweep a vehicle away. Large hail can damage property and cause injury. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm warnings are issued when imminent or occurring thunderstorms are likely to produce or are producing one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall.
